messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 312
messages.msgSnippet: i had switched to digest version about 1.5wks ago and am finding it really much harder to keep up, let alone contribute, so i may have to switch back soon!
messages.messageBody:
i had switched to digest version about 1.5wks ago and am finding it really
much harder to keep up, let alone contribute, so i may have to switch back
soon!
just wanted to say how incredible some of the discussion is that is going on
right now on this list! this particular digest i just read has left my mind
swimming... many interesting threads!!!
welcome to another erin! i will stay lowercase so we can be told apart :)
erin from tenn

messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 312
messages.msgSnippet: Kelly  wow, how hard that is when you go to talk about one thing and get harassed about something else, I had this from my OB when I was having dd#2, went in
messages.messageBody:
Kelly wow, how hard that is when you go to talk about one thing and get
harassed about something else, I had this from my OB when I was having dd#2,
went in expecting to talk about antibody levels and came out having been
done over for contemplating home-birth.

The thing is, she's a college 'educated' 'expert,' and can't see past the
end of her own nose that some people just don't do it the way she would. I
understand that you can't change doctors, since she's the only one in your
area, so this needs a different approach. How about writing to her, telling
her what you had expected, what you got and what you felt about it. If you
can include info about unschooling and some of the recent stuff posted about
living without qualifications, that will help 'educate' her so you and
others don't come up against this crap from her, and if she's career-minded,
she might even decide to do a paper on it! You're mad as hell right now, so
maybe you can use some of that mad to let her know just how damaging her
assumptions are.

Hope this helps, btw, where in WA are you, I have a friend over there...

Tracy

nose>
> What, if anything, should I do about this? Is this sort of thing to be
> expected from a psychiatrist? I am just so shocked. Maybe I am living
> in a bubble and this is common discrimination. Do the rest of you deal
> with this sort of nonsense? If so, how do you deal with it?
>
> Thanks to all who read this whole thing, and thanks in advance to all
> who respond. This has really upset me and I feel so alone right now.
>
> Kelly
>
>
>
